utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What can I do for you today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi, uh, so I just came here today uh, I've been having this cough for um, the last two weeks and it just, is not going away. I've also been getting like, just a runny nose for the last couple, I would take the whole week, all of last week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, um, so can you tell me about your cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Go on, sorry.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So, it's more of just like a dry cough. I'm not really bringing anything up.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and the runny nose, what, what's the discharge like?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh it's, it's pretty clear. It might be light, but it's not like green or yellow or anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, and so you've had this cough for two weeks and the runny nose just started last week. Has the cough improved over the past two weeks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, it has, like it was much worse last week, uh, but I just can't get like, it's better now, but it's still lasting much longer than I've had a cough before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, and uh, have you had a headache at all in these past two weeks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I didn't have a headache, but sometimes I feel a bit congested.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And uh, have you had any um, changes in your vision or your like uh, blurry vision, or any redness in your eyes or tearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, any um, changes in smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, any change in uh, taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, but uh, sorry, for smell, like when I was a bit congested I, I could smell less. I wasn't able to smell too much, but taste has been fine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and what about uh, sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no. No, sore throat.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. What about any difficulties with breathing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any palpitations or racing of your heart?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any pain in your belly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Diarrhea or constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any aches in your, any muscle aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any numbness or tingling in your arms or feet?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, okay. Uh, any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not really. Last week I maybe had a, uh, two nights, I was a bit chilly, but since then I've been fine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and uh, any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Unintentional weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, my weight's been the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Alright, and um, so it sounds like you have a cough that started two weeks ago and then you only, and then you had two nights of, uh two nights where you felt sort of cold and you had the chills um, last week, but you uh started, you developed a runny nose um, a week ago?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, the runny nose has been more, um, this week. It kind of like, started with a cough last week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: It, it, sorry, so it started with the cough last week?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, so late last week, I would say the runny nose started.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, I see. Okay um, alright. I, and um, are you um, do you have any medical conditions that you've been diagnosed with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been uh, completely healthy otherwise.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any medications that you take, including over the counter, or herbal medications, or vitamins or minerals?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no. I don't take any medication.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Allergies, including allergies to food, or environmental allergies, and allergies to medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, and any conditions, medical conditions that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I think my dad has uh, high cholesterol.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And in terms of your living situation, do you live alone?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Right now I'm uh, I usually live in a dorm going to university, but right now I'm home with my parents, uh, just doing virtual learning.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, okay. Um, and have you um, is there anyone else around in the home? Or just your parents and you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, just my parents and me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright uh, have you um, have you been around someone who might be sick, or have your parents been around someone who could be sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, my mom had the sniffles like last week, but she pretty much got over it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, did she get tested for COVID?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, she, she didn't um, but it's not like, it's just more, she just thought it was a cold or something so she didn't really bother.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: That's fair, okay. Um, and do you um, so I see that you go to school, um, and you mentioned you, have you traveled anywhere outside the, the province?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not at all. My school is actually in Ontario, so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, great. Um, and do you currently, or have you ever smoked?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, maybe like uh, a couple times just casually. I've tried it but nothing regular.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And what about marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, same, same thing like I've tried it probably like four or five times so far.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any uh, alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah, just not, not much right now, but like when I, when we were at school like we would drink on the weekends.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: That's good. Alright, um, so it sounds like you've had a cough for the past two weeks and you uh, have developed a runny nose last week, and your mom was ill the week before. It's possible that you just have a common cold uh, and that symptoms will get better over time. But just in case, we would also like to do a COVID swab, um, to make sure that you, just to rule out COVID. In the meantime, I would request that you isolate, self isolate at home. Stay away from your parents as well. Um, the test results should come back in 24 to 48 hours and public health will give you a call if your results are positive and we'll let you know what to do. Um, we will also do a physical exam here and check your temperature to see if you have a fever at all and um, yeah, does that sound good to you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, and will I need any like antibiotics for my cough?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh. Um, well, we, I guess, you said that you don't have a sore throat at all, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. It's just that, I just feel like the coughs been just going on, like it would be nice to just get rid of it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Well um, I'll do a physical exam, look inside your throat, look inside your mouth, sorry, and listen to your chest, and uh, ensure that nothing else is going on, that you don't have anything like, say, strep throat or mono or you don't have uh, pneumonia, uh, bacterial pneumonia, for instance. Oftentimes um, symptoms that you have are caused by viruses and don't need to be treated with antibiotics, uh, but I'll do a physical exam, and maybe have a look at your labs as well, and then decide accordingly.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Okay, sounds good, thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
